title: Diploma
description: This was the artist's first large-scale work, created for his degree. The tessellation is inspired by a tensegrity structure discovered by David Georges Emmerich in the 1960s. The use of bambu poles cut at various lengths based on the location of their nodes makes it a challenge to match the target shape. Ludovic Regnault solved this problem with an algorithm that optimally positions each bar to find the most fit shape.
